intro: Alsinanthus trinervius, commonly known as the three-veined alsinath, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are opposite and have three distinct veins, giving it its scientific name. Alsinanthus trinervius is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow in well-drained conditions.
